sentences.en: a momentary lapse of concentration
sentences.cn: 走神儿

sentences.en: a time-lapse sequence of a flower opening
sentences.cn: 一组延时拍摄花蕾开放的镜头

sentences.en: After taking the drug, several patients suffered memory lapses (= when you cannot remember something for a short time ).
sentences.cn: 若干病人服用此药后记忆短暂丧失。

sentences.en: Ford allowed the name and trademark to lapse during the Eighties.
sentences.cn: 福特在20世纪80年代废止了该名称和商标。

sentences.en: He forgot to offer Darren a drink, but Marie did not appear to notice the lapse.
sentences.cn: 他忘了给达伦倒饮料，玛丽好像也没有注意到这个疏忽。

sentences.en: He is usually well - behaved; this rudeness is only a lapse.
sentences.cn: 他一向彬彬有礼, 这次的无礼只是一时的失态.

sentences.en: He knew that he might soon lapse into unconsciousness.
sentences.cn: 他知道自己可能很快就会失去知觉。

sentences.en: He was a genius and because of it you could accept lapses of taste.
sentences.cn: 他是一个天才，因此他偶失得体，人们也可以接受。

sentences.en: Her lapse into German didn't seem peculiar. After all, it was her native tongue.
sentences.cn: 她冒出几句德语并不足为奇.毕竟那是她的母语.

sentences.en: I declined, or rather let lapse, both invitations.
sentences.cn: 我对两次邀请都谢绝了, 或者让它自然地推诿过去了.

sentences.en: I had a little lapse of concentration in the middle of the race.
sentences.cn: 我在比赛中途一时走神。

sentences.en: On Friday he showed neither decency nor dignity. It was an uncommon lapse.
sentences.cn: 星期五那天他的表现既不得体，又有失尊严。如此失态非常少有。

sentences.en: Teenagers occasionally find it all too much to cope with and lapse into bad behaviour.
sentences.cn: 青少年偶尔会因感到压力太大无所适从而做出不良行为。

sentences.en: The debate was marred by a brief lapse into unpleasant name - calling.
sentences.cn: 因出现几句谩骂,辩论会不欢而散.

sentences.en: The incident was being seen as a serious security lapse.
sentences.cn: 这一事故被看作是一次严重的安全疏忽。

sentences.en: The lapse of year will never efface that scene of ruin from my memory.
sentences.cn: 时光的流逝绝不会把那废墟的景象从我的记忆中冲淡。

sentences.en: The lapse of year will never efface that scene of ruins from my memory.
sentences.cn: 时光的流逝绝不会把那废墟的景象从我的记忆中冲淡.

sentences.en: The moment he relaxes his concentration, he will lapse into a stutter.
sentences.cn: 他思想一不集中, 就结结巴巴起来.

sentences.en: Under union pressure, this law was permitted to lapse in 1966.
sentences.cn: 在工会的压力下, 这项法令于一九六六年取消了.

sentences.en: Your booking will automatically lapse unless you confirm it.
sentences.cn: 如果不加以确认，您的预订将自动失效。

words.tran_cn: 失效的；堕落的；转归他人的
陷入（lapse的过去分词）；流逝；结束

trans.tran_cn: 小错，疏忽，行为失检，失足，流逝，[法]（权利等的）失效，消失
trans.tran_en: A lapse of something such as concentration or judgment is a temporary lack of that thing, which can often cause you to make a mistake

trans.tran_cn: 退步，陷入，堕入，失效，终止，[法]转归
trans.tran_en: if a contract, agreement etc lapses, it comes to an end, usually because an agreed time limit has passed
